cluster_classes.class_description: Core concepts of Einsteinian gravitation, including the curved spacetime manifold and the classical theory that governs its dynamics.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Spacetime as a four-dimensional continuum warped by gravity and general relativity as Einstein’s classical theory of gravitation.

members.entity_description: The four-dimensional continuum of space and time that is affected and warped by gravity, including by black holes.
Einstein’s classical theory of gravitation describing gravity as the curvature of spacetime and defining the domain where its predictions are applicable, including black hole singularities.

remarks: This class is now an empty legacy container after splitting its members into dedicated spacetime and general relativity classes; consider removing or hiding it in future revisions.

cluster_classes.class_description: The totality of space, time, matter, energy, and governing physical laws, encompassing all cosmological structures and phenomena.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: the totality of cosmic space, time, matter, energy, and physical laws considered as an ordered, unified whole

members.entity_description: The totality of cosmic space, time, matter, energy, and physical laws considered as an ordered, unified whole, within which black holes and other phenomena exist.

cluster_classes.class_description: The core set of physical principles governing matter, energy, space, and time, potentially requiring modification in extreme regimes such as black hole singularities.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: basic physical principles that govern the behavior of matter, energy, space, and time, which may break down or require modification in extreme conditions

members.entity_description: The basic physical principles that govern the behavior of matter, energy, space, and time, which may break down or require modification in extreme conditions such as black hole singularities.

splits.name: Spacetime
splits.description: The four-dimensional continuum of space and time that is affected and warped by gravity, including by massive objects and black holes.

splits.name: General Relativity
splits.description: Einstein's classical theory of gravitation describing gravity as the curvature of spacetime and defining the domain where its predictions are applicable, including black hole singularities.

args.justification: The original 'Relativistic Gravity' class bundles a core geometrical concept (spacetime) and a specific theory (general relativity); splitting improves type coherence between concepts and theories.
args.remark: Source class ClsC_ecfd5740 has had all members moved into more precise subclasses; consider deprecating or removing this legacy container in a later cleanup pass.

args.new_description: The four-dimensional continuum of space and time that is affected and warped by gravity, forming the geometric arena for relativistic physics and cosmology.
args.justification: Assigns a stable class group tying spacetime to related cosmology and gravity concepts and slightly clarifies its role as the geometric arena of relativistic physics.

args.new_description: Einstein's classical theory of gravitation that describes gravity as the curvature of spacetime and underpins modern cosmology and black hole physics.
args.justification: Places general relativity in the same high-level group as cosmology and fundamental physics while refining its description to match its role in the schema.

args.new_description: The totality of cosmic space, time, matter, energy, and physical laws considered as an ordered, unified whole, within which structures like galaxies and black holes exist.
args.justification: Aligns the universe class with the same overarching group as relativistic gravity and fundamental laws, clarifying its role as the cosmological whole.

args.new_description: The core set of physical principles governing matter, energy, space, and time, which may require modification in extreme regimes such as black hole singularities.
args.justification: Groups the fundamental laws of physics with cosmology and relativistic gravity, reflecting that these laws govern the same spacetime and cosmic domain.

args.new_description: Former container class for both spacetime and general relativity; all members have been moved into more precise classes.
args.remark: This class is now an empty legacy container after splitting its members into dedicated spacetime and general relativity classes; consider removing or hiding it in future revisions.
args.justification: Updates metadata to reflect that this class is now an empty legacy container after splitting, while still tying it to the same high-level cosmology and fundamental physics group.
